snippet: Agency officials are enraged by strikes on its facilities and mounting civilian casualties in Gaza, while Israel accuses the United Nations of playing down Hamas’s role in the conflict.
abstract: Tensions escalate between the United Nations and Israel over Israeli attack in Gaza Strip that killed at least 19 people who were taking refuge at a UN school; strikes bring barrage of rebukes and warnings from senior UN officials as Israel, in turn, accuses the world of helping Hamas; behind-the-scene efforts by diplomats dealing with all parties in conflict lead to 72-hour humanitarian cease-fire.
lead_paragraph: Agency officials are enraged by strikes on its facilities and mounting civilian casualties in Gaza, while Israel accuses the United Nations of playing down Hamas’s role in the conflict.

headline.main: Tensions Escalate Between Israel and a Second Party in Gaza: The United Nations
headline.print_headline: Tensions Escalate Between Israel and a Second Party in Gaza: The United Nations

keywords.value: United Nations Relief and Works Agency
keywords.name: organizations
